passage_text: Full time enrollment for federal student aid (Pell Grant, etc.) and insurance verification purposes is 12 or more credit hours. Tuition is assessed at one of three levels per semester: 1. Standard tuition cost is $89 per credit hour for in-state, Georgia residents. Maximum per term: $1,335.00. 2. Out-of-state students pay tuition twice the amount charged for Georgia residents.

Annual Total Cost. The total list price for in-state Georgia residents to go to Chattahoochee Technical College is $9,531 for the 2014/2015 academic year. Out-of-state students who don't possess Georgia residence can expect a one year cost of $11,667. This could be your effective total out of pocket cost of an education at Chattahoochee Technical College. Note that this calculation assumes you don't pay full list price tuition, are part of the reported 87% of students at this school who receive financial aid and you are paying an average annual net price of $6,365.

Out-of-State : $4,818. Chattahoochee Technical College's in-state tuition is more expensive than the average public 2 year college in Georgia's in-state tuition ($2,388), but it is cheaper than the average college in Georgia's in-state tuition ($7,680). The school's out-of-state tuition is more expensive than the average public 2 year college in Georgia's out-of-state tuition ($4,489), but it is cheaper than the average college in Georgia's out-of-state tuition ($9,648). 2014-2015 Academic Year.

Chattahoochee Technical College is public, 2-4 years located in Marietta, Georgia. For academic year 2014-2015, the undergraduate tuition & fees at Chattahoochee Technical College is $2,682 for in-state and $4,818 for out-of-state students. Average living costs is $5,899 for students living off campus. On-campus living costs stayed same from the previous year

The cost is $2,903 and 58% cheaper than the average Georgia tuition of $5,039 for 2 year colleges.
